prompt: Write a poem about underpass echo in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep ballad rhyme (ABAB/ABCB) and a lively alternating cadence. Invent new coinages in each stanza and introduce a named creature. Add onomatopoeia and some alliteration. Arc: warning → preparation → encounter/slay → return/celebration. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
The Echobrack of the Underpass

In the dusky underpass of the glooming night,  
Where specters swirl and shadows slither sly,  
A warning whisper wails through the endless light,  
Beware the Echobrack that's booming by!  

With frumpled feet and gritty grasp so keen,  
Our hero dons the fulgazed cloak of stealth,  
Arms himself with the vibrazor, sharp and sheen,  
To charge the echo-craven, thiefing wealth.  

Through tunnels tunny, twisty-turns of stone,  
He hears the brutish boar-beat of its bound,  
The Echobrack erupts in rumbles green and lone,  
With howl and huzzah, heroes clash all around!  

Frashazzle fray! The vibrazor stabs and stings,  
Whack-wobble, whirr! The beast's defeats descend,  
Its echoes ebb like fading firefly wings,  
The victor vanquishes, his valor at the end.  

Back to the bright beyond, with heartbeat bold and free,  
He dances deftly under starlit span,  
No more the menace of the murky spree,  
In the dusky underpass of the glooming night, he's gone!
label: high

prompt: Write a poem about morning fog in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep ballad rhyme (ABAB/ABCB) and a lively alternating cadence. Invent new coinages in each stanza and introduce a named creature. Add onomatopoeia and some alliteration. Arc: warning → preparation → encounter/slay → return/celebration. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
### The Fogwock

In morn’s misty veil, where the Fogwock doth dwell,  
Beware the blosch, that breath-banished spell,  
Its tusks all atwinkle, its claws thrashery keen,  
Whisper a chumble, oh traveler, flee!  

So clutch thy swift fumple, thy brander ungirthed,  
With quivel and quix in thy pouch well-insured,  
Seek out the brimbly trail through the haze,  
For Fogwock’s a-slinking with sneaky-gaze ways.  

Then burble and twizzle! The beast leaps aglow,  
With frumble and flubble, it lunges and low,  
Thrash’d by thy fumple’s deft whizz and wham,  
It crumples and cringes, defeat in a slam!  

Back home with thy prize, the morn clear and bright,  
Neighbors all cheer with aprowl and delight,  
No more the blosch spell in the whispy misted morn,  
Fogwock’s been foiled, and the skies once reborn.  

In morn’s misty veil, where the Fogwock did dwell,  
Beware no more blosch, that breath-banished spell,  
Its tusks now atinkle, its claws thrashery clean,  
Echo a chumble, the traveler’s gone free!
label: high

prompt: Write a poem about déjà vu in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep ballad rhyme (ABAB/ABCB) and a lively alternating cadence. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
### The Slithèyre Déjavouk

’Twas glimm’ring in the mornis shade,  
Where frathery farns did flicker-flame,  
And wibbly winds did wuftle-up,  
With dread of déjà, that daz’ling game.  

Beware the Slithèyre Déjavouk, my son!  
Its scaly scales, its inky inkling gaze,  
All mumpish muddles in your memory run,  
It sniver-snacks your shadow-days!  

So bucked my sword on bandersnatchy belt,  
And nimble nim’rous nerves did twang and thrum,  
Vorpal vibers in my vest did melt,  
To hunt the haunt that makes the hiccups hum.  

And, as in splashy spritzles I did wade,  
The Déjavouk from dither-dens did gleam,  
Its flum’rous fronds o’ertwafted, spiraled shade—  
I called it out, and it did kipple-dream!  

Then frump’ly fought we in the sylvan sift,  
It whiffled woefully with walrus woe,  
One, two—vorpal slash! It frubbed and shrift,  
O’erglimmed, o’ergrimm, and tumbled low.  

Triumphant toddled I back home that eve,  
To hearth where fuzzy flustered friends did feast,  
With vixish verses, vivids in relieve,  
The Déjavivers all laid to rest!  

’Twas glimm’ring in the mornis shade,  
Where frathery farns did flicker-flame,  
And wibbly winds did wuftle-up,  
With cheer of déjà, that renownèd game.
label: high

Invent new coinages in each stanza and introduce a named creature. Add onomatopoeia and some alliteration. Arc: warning → preparation → encounter/slay → return/celebration. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
### The Pathroke Slain

'Twas brillig in the wishwick wood,  
Where trodden trails bend snarly wild,  
And frumpled ferns and twisted roots  
Entuggle bold the well-worn path.  

Beware the Pathroke, fearsome beast!  
Its claws are sharp, its fangs agley,  
It flexes foe with flangle might,  
And bounds in bounding, bumbling wrath.  

I grabbed my wirble-headed cane,  
My trusty trodder sneakers tight,  
With whistlewarp and glingleglow,  
I ventured forth in morning light.  

The Pathroke roared a throbbly growl,  
With eyes that gleamed like gleepy gleams,  
It lungled leaps in loopy loops,  
Its spiny spine a-sparkling bright.  

I whiffed my cane with whifflestrike,  
And slashed its snorfle-snortling hide,  
The Pathroke fell with flumbly flop,  
Its wretched wrenkle life expired.  

I strolled the path with prideful pace,  
Back home to hearth and hearty cheer,  
Where tales of triumph twinkle true,  
With echoed trails no longer wild.  

'Twas brillig in the wishwick wood,  
Where trodden trails bend snarly straight,  
And frumpled ferns and twisted roots  
Now whisper of the well-worn fate.
label: high

poem:
### The Confidereeco

In the conference room, where projectors gleam,  
A dreaded Confidereeco roams free,  
Its claws click-clack on the powdery screens,  
Broadcasting blibberblabs oh refractorily.  

Two presentians, with voxulite pens,  
Prepared their brumblebombs all aglow,  
One steered the swivelship staunchly,  
The other scribbled scrawls for the blow.  

Beware the sharp elbows, the mumblesteen gaze,  
And shun the sharp-witted Dealdunderer’s snag,  
Yet swift as a slideshow, they pounced with a whoosh,  
Crushing the crawlers with clap-trap and brag.  

They battled the beast in the boardroom’s bright storm,  
With onomatopoeic pows and ker-bлопs so grand,  
The Confidereeco now fallen, victim to form,  
They cheered their triumph with jabberjack hands.  

And thus, in the conference room, where projectors gleam,  
No more does the Confidereeco reside,  
But echoes of echoes still whisper and dream,  
Of presentians' victory, eternally bide!
label: high
